Metric: Walk Free+MSA Identification of risks
Comments: Nestle discloses responsible sourcing from their six priority raw materials by resource and geographic location. E.G. they have specifically developed an Action Plan on Labor Rights in Palm Oil Supply Chains, and in 2020 with their partner Verite developed a Program Assurance Framework to upgrade their Labor Rights Actions Plan for Palm Oil. It specifically acknowledges that labour rights challenges must be addressed at industry level, and are developing a toolkit to assess their current systems and practices against labour standards in the Palm Oil supply chain. Their Hazelnuts responsible sourcing report specifically discloses remedial actions taken in turkey, their primary supplier of hazelnuts. Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:11:55 UTC

Metric: Walk Free+MSA Identification of risks (binary)
Walk Free+MSA Identification of risks (grouped)
Walk Free+MSA Impact on Company Behaviour
Comments: The document serves as a statement of direct compliance with the Modern Slavery Act 2018 in Australia, and the Modern Slavery Act 2015 in the UK. Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:21:20 UTC

Metric: Walk Free+MSA incidents identified
Comments: Nestle specifically identified remedial actions taken in Turkey, including but not limited to brokering formal contracts with workers, farmers and labour brokers prior to harvest, increase in personal protective equipment kids, and improved water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) conditions. Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:13:51 UTC Additionally in Turkey, they provided training for 4454 farmers, workers and labour brokers on workers' rights and child labour. Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:14:20 UTC p.21 Number of messages received 1,624 Number of cases investigated and closed 1,583 Number of cases substantiated 464 Issues included: abuse of power, harassment, bullying, labour practices and kickbacks" Pooja Yadav[https://wikirate.org/Pooja_Yadav].....2024-08-26 08:36:51 UTC

Metric: Walk Free+MSA incidents remediation (binary)
Walk Free+MSA incidents remediation (revised)
Comments: Identifying modern slavery incidents such as child labour in sourcing sugar, Nestle has put a particular focus on improving conditions for workers and children in Mexico. "Together with Proforest and its local partner, ABC Mexico, we have been working to address the issue of child labour with two supplying mills: La Gloria mill in Veracruz and Grupo Beta San Miguel (BSM). Initially, we supported them in developing policies together with implementation and monitoring plans, followed by training and awareness-raising activities in the field with the aim of supporting the mills to develop an approach to reduce the number of children working in the field over time. As a result, both mills have taken significant steps to identify and prevent child labour in their supply base. In addition, we have worked with the sugar mills to improve living conditions for seasonal migrant workers, and to improve the safety conditions of cane cutters." Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:16:16 UTC

Metric: Walk Free+MSA KPIs (combined)
Walk Free+MSA Organizational structure and operations
Comments: Nestle discloses globally working with 165,000 direct suppliers, also known as Tier 1 suppliers, including sourcing directly from 626,700 smallholder farms. It also discloses the key brands under its umbrella in both Australia and the UK & Ireland Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 20:56:54 UTC

Metric: Walk Free+MSA Performance Indicators
Comments: While there are no specific metrics relating to number of audits done, there is a large amount of information with numbers specifically speaking to remedial action taken, including number of workers trained, and monitoring of children along their supply chain in order to reduce incidences of child labour. "By the end of 2020, we had trained almost all our employees on human rights, with 157,250 completing their training during the year and bringing the total number of Nestlé employees completing training to 283,532 since 2011. " " More than 73,000 agricultural supply chain workers benefited from our interventions to address and improve labour rights issues in 2020, with interventions including provision of grievance mechanisms, training on labour rights or renovation of worker accommodation." Comments: Nestle uses a Labour Rights Roadmap, based on human rights assessments, and an automated Compliance Audit Program (CARE) reports on mandatory training courses and demonstrates specific human rights issues associated with different raw material supply chains. Value: Audits of suppliers (self- reporting), Audits of suppliers (independent), On-site visits (self- reporting)
Comments: Nestle has a responsible sourcing strategy which is guided by their Responsible Sourcing Standard. It includes specific requirements on preventing child labour, promoting labour rights in agricultural supply chains, and helping to ensure good conditions of work and employment. Farm assessments are conducted with partner organisations such as Proforest and Earthworm Foundation. Their tier 1 audit program has been updated to include compliance per site (instead of spend and volume) and focuses their resources on the higher risk and most important suppliers. Kaz Tyabji[https://wikirate.org/Kaz_Tyabji].....2022-03-15 21:08:13 UTC
